lines.text: The very beginning. No floor, the ceiling needed replacing, kind of bland white paint job, no fixtures, no tables, just a very bare foundation of what would soon take the shape of a ful scale retail store.
lines.text_raw: The very beginning. No floor, the ceiling needed replacing, kind of bland white paint job, no fixtures, no tables, just a very bare foundation of what would soon take the shape of a ful scale retail store.

lines.text: After laying down carpet, we got to work on our display tables. We picked up a pair of old, slatted doors, and set them on top of handmade sawhorses. We stained the sawhorses a dark chestnut color, then painted the doors red, distressed them, attached some antique doorknobs. And there we had it,  completely unique and hand crafted display tables.
lines.text_raw: After laying down carpet, we got to work on our display tables. We picked up a pair of old, slatted doors, and set them on top of handmade sawhorses. guide.summary: This guide will demonstrate how to open a full scale DIY retail location, on a very modest budget. In June 2012, I opened an upscale thrift and custom furniture store, this guide aims to demonstrate how to create an unforgettable shopping experience.
guide.title: The Coastal Theory Store
